author: AOL Staff
title: Sensitivity over killing grey squirrels is ‘stupidity’, says Tory ex-minister
text: Sensitivity over killing grey squirrels is ‘stupidity’, says Tory ex-minister Public sensitivity over killing grey squirrels has been branded “stupidity” by a Tory former minister. Lord Robathan pointed to people’s adverse reaction if a dog caught one in a park and highlighted opposition to the trapping of the invasive rodent. He revealed he had captured 14 on his own farm since Christmas Day but there were “still hundreds left”. He argued numbers had to be reduced to realise the Government’s tree-planting ambitions because of the damage caused by the bark-stripping pests, which have been blamed for the decline of the native red squirrel. Lord Robathan also challenged the need for a licence to shoot members of the corvid bird family, such as magpies and crows. He was speaking during a debate in the House of Lords on financial support for farmers and species management. The Conservative peer, who served in the SAS, said: “We used to have when I bought my farm 20 odd years ago, we would have curlews there every year, which is magnificent, a lowland farm in the Midlands. “However, we now almost never see curlews and the reason probably is not foxes because we don’t see that many foxes, but it’s really corvids. “Now peers may not know that you need a licence to show that you can shoot corvids or control corvids.” Lord Robathan added: “Magpies, which are very clever birds and easily tamed by the way, if you watch them in the next couple of months you will see them working their way down a hedge, sticking their heads in looking for nesting birds. And when they find a nesting bird they destroy them. “Each magpie might be responsible for the destruction of 10 nests, I don’t know, I haven’t studied it closely enough. “But under the Wildlife and Countryside Act 1981 you need a licence. You need to be able to prove that magpies or crows are causing damage. “What is the point of that?” Turning to grey squirrels, he said: “I have planted a lot of trees. I should think in one wood a third of the trees have been killed by grey squirrels, so I trap them. “This is legal I am glad to say because otherwise I probably wouldn’t tell you. “I have caught 14 since Christmas day in some traps. I am catching them the whole time. There are still hundreds left, but they do so much damage. “You do have people challenging the trapping.” He warned against any suggestion of making it illegal to cull grey squirrels in light of the goal to plant more trees. Lord Robathan went on: “I should also say about killing squirrels. Public sensitivity is one issue. I’d say some stupidity amongst the public. “If you don’t believe me take your dog for a walk in the park and see what happens if it kills a squirrel in front of a lot other people. “There’s concern and confusion over general licences… and what one can and cannot do. “Less, in this case, regulation, is more. We don’t need endless regulations and laws to do what is right and humane. “Some people will behave badly with or without laws and regulations. “I suggest we can do with less regulation on the control, of destructive species as well as tree planting and agriculture as a whole.” Labour frontbencher Baroness Hayman of Ullock said: “There’s a real threat of the grey squirrel population in the areas where we are still fortunate to have red squirrels.” Environment minister Lord Douglas-Miller said: “Through countryside stewardship we already pay for actions to manage deer and grey squirrels to protect our woodlands.”

author: Madison Kemeny
title: Tom Segura bringing comedy tour to Buffalo: Where to buy tickets - syracuse.com
text: Comedian Tom Segura is bringing his [“Come Together Tour”](https://go.skimresources.com?id=126006X1587360&xs=1&url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.vividseats.com%2Ftom-segura-tickets--theater-comedy%2Fperformer%2F36221) to the KeyBank Center in Buffalo, NY, on Friday, September 27. The show starts at 8 p.m. and is part of the second leg of his global stand-up tour following the phenomenal success of his last tour, “I’m Coming Everywhere.” Segura’s “Come Together Tour” is set to showcase his latest hour of comedy, delivering fresh material that draws from personal experiences and blends observational humor with his trademark storytelling style. Where to buy Tom Segura tickets Tickets can be purchased online through [Ticketmaster](https://go.skimresources.com?id=126006X1587360&xs=1&url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.ticketmaster.com%2Fevent%2F00006073B5B92C51) and secondary market platforms such as [Vivid Seats](https://go.skimresources.com?id=126006X1587360&xs=1&url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.vividseats.com%2Ftom-segura-tickets-buffalo-keybank-center-9-27-2024--theater-comedy%2Fproduction%2F4891451), [SeatGeek](https://seatgeek.pxf.io/c/1810056/1753574/20501?u=https%3A%2F%2Fseatgeek.com%2Ftom-segura-tickets%2Fcomedy%2F2024-09-27-8-pm%2F6450320) and [StubHub](https://go.skimresources.com?id=126006X1587360&xs=1&url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.stubhub.com%2Ftom-segura-buffalo-tickets-9-27-2024%2Fevent%2F153313619%2F), which offer verified tickets with a buyer’s guarantee. Here’s a look at the best prices available (including fees): [Vivid Seats](https://go.skimresources.com?id=126006X1587360&xs=1&url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.vividseats.com%2Ftom-segura-tickets-buffalo-keybank-center-9-27-2024--theater-comedy%2Fproduction%2F4891451): Starting at $24.63 [SeatGeek](https://seatgeek.pxf.io/c/1810056/1753574/20501?u=https%3A%2F%2Fseatgeek.com%2Ftom-segura-tickets%2Fcomedy%2F2024-09-27-8-pm%2F6450320): Starting at $32 [StubHub](https://go.skimresources.com?id=126006X1587360&xs=1&url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.stubhub.com%2Ftom-segura-buffalo-tickets-9-27-2024%2Fevent%2F153313619%2F): Starting at $26 [Ticketmaster](https://go.skimresources.com?id=126006X1587360&xs=1&url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.ticketmaster.com%2Fevent%2F00006073B5B92C51): Starting at $37.80 Prices and availability are noted at the time of publishing and are subject to change. A complete list of Segura’s tour dates is available [here](https://go.skimresources.com?id=126006X1587360&xs=1&url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.vividseats.com%2Ftom-segura-tickets--theater-comedy%2Fperformer%2F36221). Segura is best known for his stand-up comedy specials “Sledgehammer,” “Ball Hog,” “Disgraceful” and “Completely Normal,” among others. In addition to stand-up comedy, Segura co-hosts popular podcasts like “Your Mom’s House,” which he runs with his wife, comedian Christina Pazsitzky, and “2 Bears, 1 Cave,” alongside fellow comedian Bert Kreischer. He’s also made appearances in several films and television shows, including “Instant Family” and “The Late Show with Stephen Colbert.” More [concert tickets](https://www.syracuse.com/topic/concert tickets) [Stevie Wonder 'Sing Your Song!' tour coming to NYC for election season](https://www.syracuse.com/live-entertainment/2024/09/stevie-wonder-sing-your-song-tour-coming-to-nyc-for-election-season.html) [Teddy Swims performing in Upstate NY: When, where, tickets](https://www.syracuse.com/live-entertainment/2024/09/teddy-swims-performing-in-upstate-ny-when-where-tickets.html) [Jelly Roll to perform sold-out show in Albany: How to get tickets](https://www.syracuse.com/live-entertainment/2024/09/jelly-roll-to-perform-sold-out-show-in-albany-how-to-get-tickets.html) [Rock & Roll Hall of Fame inductee going on fall tour, includes two NYC shows](https://www.syracuse.com/live-entertainment/2024/09/rock-roll-hall-of-fame-inductee-going-on-fall-tour-includes-two-nyc-shows.html) [Zayn Malik's first solo tour 'Stairway to the Sky' includes NYC show](https://www.syracuse.com/live-entertainment/2024/09/zayn-maliks-first-solo-tour-stairway-to-the-sky-includes-nyc-show.html)

author: world today news
title: KPK arrests 1 new suspect in bribery case for railway challenge
text:
Jakarta –
KPK introduced PPK DJKA Ministry of Transport (Kemenhub) Cirebon Kroya Double Observe Development September 2017-2020 Yofi Okatrisza as a suspect within the case a bribe of the Director Basic of Railways, Ministry of Transport, relating to the development of railway traces within the areas of South Sulawesi, Central Java, West Java and Java-Sumatra for the price range yr 2018-2022. Yofi was instantly detained.
“On this case, a number of witnesses have been examined and associated proof was launched. After discovering sufficient proof, the investigators recognized YO because the Dedication Officer of BTP Class 1 Central Java which grew to become BTP Semarang in 2017 to 2021 as a suspect,” stated Director KPK will study Asep Guntur at a press convention at KPK Pink and White Constructing, Jalan Kuningan Persada, Thursday (13/6/2024).
“For investigation functions, suspected YO was detained for the primary 20 days from June 13 to July 2, 2024 on the KPK Department Detention Heart,” he stated.
Asep stated that this case was a growth of the PT proprietor’s bribery case. Putra Agung Palace, Dion Renato Sugiarto to PPK at BTP Semarang, Bernard Hasibuan and CEO of BTP Class 1 Semarang, Putu Sumarjaya. Asep stated Yofi was PPK on a number of tasks in Central Java.
Asep defined that Yofi is the PPK for a number of tasks, together with the improve of the Purwokerto-Kroya railway line in 2017. Then, the Cross Banjar-Kroya railway line in 2018, and the Cross Banjar-Kroya railway line in 2020 .
Not solely that, the 2019 Cirebon-Kroya double monitor development actions as much as PPK Space II embrace the development or growth or upkeep or renovation of development services and prepare operations. Asep stated that Yofi, in finishing up the challenge, was suspected of rigging the public sale course of by profitable over Dion’s corporations.
“For this help, PPK, together with Suspect YO, obtained charges from companions together with DRS within the quantity of 10% to twenty% of the worth of the allotted work bundle ,” stated Asep.
Asep revealed the proportion of charges from companions when Suspect YO served as PPK, together with:
1) For PPK it’s 4%
2) For BPK it’s 1% to 1.5%.
3) For ITJEN of the Ministry of Transport, it’s 0.5%.
4) For Provide Working Group 0.5%.
5) For BTP CEO it’s 3%.
The Corruption Eradication Fee (KPK) had beforehand named 13 suspects, whereas the identification of one other particular person was not disclosed by the Corruption Eradication Committee. So, the overall variety of suspects up to now is 14 folks. They’re divided into teams of bribe takers and bribe givers.
The 12 suspects on this case beforehand described are:
The Giver
1. DIN (Dion Renato Sugiarto), Director of PT IPA (Patra Agung Palace)
2. MUH (Muchamad Hikmat), PT DF Director (Dwifarita Fajarkharisma)
3. YOS (Yoseph Ibrahim), Director of PT KA Properti Administration sd. February 2023
4. PAR (Parjono), VP PT KA Property Administration
5. Asta Danika (AD), Director PT Bhakti Karya Utama (BKU)
6. Zulfikar Fahmi (ZF), Director PT Putra Kharisma Sejahtera (PKS).
Recipient occasion
1. HNO (Harno Trimadi), Director of Railway Infrastructure
2. BEN (Bernard Hasibuan), PPK BTP Jabagteng
3. PTU (Putu Sumarjaya), Head of BTP Jabagteng
4. AFF (Achmad Affandi), PPK BPKA South Sulawesi
5. FAD (Fadliansyah), PPK Railway Infrastructure Upkeep
6. SYN (Syntho Pirjani Hutabarat), PPK BTP Jabagbar.

author: Equipe br.PokerNews
title: Freeroll com US$ 20.000 em Prêmios no WPT Global - Exclusivo para Brasileiros! | PokerNews
text: Freeroll com US$ 20.000 em Prêmios no WPT Global - Exclusivo para Brasileiros! O [WPT Global](/wpt-global/) está comemorando a mais nova edição do [WPT Winter Festival](https://br.pokernews.com/noticias/2023/12/winter-festival-wpt-global-55338.htm) — série de torneios com US$ 4 milhões garantidos rolando no site até 14 de janeiro — com um freeroll especial e exclusivo para jogadores brasileiros com incríveis US$ 20.000 em prêmios. Como posso participar do freeroll? Para participar do freeroll exclusivo e brigar por uma parte dos US$ 20 mil em tickets para o Winter Festival em disputa você tem duas opções: - Jogar pelo menos 20 mãos de cash game - Jogar pelo menos 1 torneio (de qualquer valor) entre 05/01 e 10/01/2024 Assim que cumprir um dos dois requisitos acima, você receberá seu ticket e depois basta se registrar para participar do freeroll que acontece em 11 de janeiro às 20:00 BRT. Além da premiação regular, o WPT Global colocou um bounty de US$ 220 na cabeça de seis convidados especiais. Isso significa que você receberá automaticamente um bounty de US$ 220 caso elimine um desses jogadores. Os seis jogadores com a cabeça a prêmio no freeroll, e seus nicknames no WPT Global, são os seguintes: - Andressa Lincoln "SCALONETA" - Dani Leão "Danileao11" - Marcelo Medeiros "Marcelinhobf" - Tainá de Lima "Raposa2024" - Thiago Torati "tOrati" - Anthony Barranqueiros "TonyTornado" [Mais de US$ 4 Milhões Garantidos no Winter Festival do WPT Global](https://br.pokernews.com/noticias/2023/12/winter-festival-wpt-global-55338.htm) Comece a jogar no WPT Global com um generoso Bônus de Boas-vindas É claro que, para participar do Freeroll de US$ 20.000, você precisa ter uma conta no WPT Gobal. Caso ainda não tenha uma, você pode fazer o [download do WPT Global através do PokerNews](/wpt-global/ext/), criar uma conta grátis e desfrutar de um bônus de boas-vindas de 100% até US$ 1.200, mais tickets de satélite do [WPT World Championship](https://br.pokernews.com/noticias/2023/08/jogue-o-wpt-world-championship-de-graca-com-o-wpt-global-54191.htm) e tickets do Sunday Slam WPT Global Spins, dependendo do tamanho do seu depósito inicial. |Jogadores Novos ou Existentes||Nº do depósito||Depósito mínimo||Recompensa| |Apenas novos||1º||US$ 20||2x tickets US$ 5 para WPT Global Spins & 2x tickets US$ 5 de satélite WPT Passport| |Novos e Existentes||2º||US$ 20 (2º depósito deste valor)||1x ticket US$ 10 para WPT Global Spins & 2x tickets US$ 5 de satélite WPT Passport| |Novos e Existentes||Próximo depósito de US$ 300+||US$ 300||Todas as ofertas acima + Ticket US$ 110 Sunday Slam & 2x tickets US$ 10 para WPT Global Spins| |Novos e Existentes||Próximo depósito de US$ 1.200+||US$ 1.200||Todas as ofertas acima + Ticket US$ 110 Sunday Slam & 2x tickets US$ 50 para WPT Global Spins & 1x ticket US$ 25 para WPT Global Spins|

author: Andy Gregory
title: Police warned 'there will be more knives' as teachers fear plan to take officers from London schools
text:
Police warned ‘there will be more knives’ as teachers fear plan to take officers from London schools
Scotland Yard says decision to transfer 371 safer schools officers into neighbourhood policing roles was ‘not taken lightly’
Andy Gregory Comments
Teachers and pupils have expressed their fears over plans by the
Metropolitan Police to remove more than 300 specialist officers from long-held posts in London schools. Headteachers have warned that pupils will be put at greater risk of violence and exploitation by gangs if the force presses ahead with its decision to withdraw 371 safer schools officers (SSOs) from their posts, starting from next month.
One pupil expressed fears that “there will be more
knives” and “drugs coming into school with nobody to actually stop it” if the plans to transfer SSOs into neighbourhood policing teams goes ahead. Scotland Yard has written to headteachers saying the decision was “not made lightly”, after warning it had been forced into “tough choices” amid a £260m budget shortfall, which is expected to result in 1,700 layoffs.
The force argued that, in their new posts, the transferred officers “will retain strong relationships with schools to ensure that any reports of knife crime can be dealt with quickly”.
Arguing that the “primary risk” to young people “exists outside the school grounds, for example, in the travel corridor between school and home,” the force added: “That is why we are changing our approach to ensure our efforts are focused on the wider community.”
But in a joint letter, seen by The Independent, 15 headteachers from schools in northeast London have warned the Met that, “without the support of safer school officers, vulnerable students may become prey to exploitation and, in turn, perpetrators of crime”.
The headteachers warned that such officers “play a critical role in ensuring the safety and well-being of students”, adding: “They are highly effective at addressing potential problems before they spiral out of control.”
Knife crime rose 18 per cent in London to hit a record high of 16,521 offences during the year to September 2024, according to the Office for National Statistics.
Figures
obtained by The Independent last year showed that police received 37 reports of attacks involving blades or sharp instruments during term time in London schools in 2023, and 173 regarding incidents of weapon possession, which can also include broken glass.
SSOs were first introduced to schools in 2009 and – by 2023 – there
were close to 1,000 operating across the UK, data obtained by the Runnymede Trust showed – with the charity warning at the time of a “deeply concerning” and “normalised” police presence.
Pointing to the
Child Q scandal, in which a Black schoolgirl was strip-searched by police while on her period and without another adult present, after being wrongly suspected of carrying cannabis, the charity criticised “the highly racialised and damaging impact excessive force can have inside a school setting”, and called for the removal of SSOs.
But with such a move now set to happen en masse in London, Chris Hall, headteacher of Footsteps Trust in Haringey, told Sky News that SSOs had been “very, very, valuable assets” who had helped familiarise “young people with the police in the most positive way”.
One 14-year-old pupil at the Footsteps Trust told the broadcaster that “if anything happens outside of school you can tell them [SSOs] and let them know”, warning: “There will be more knives. There will be fighting, there will be drugs coming into school and no one will be there to actually stop it.”
A Metropolitan Police spokesperson told the Evening Standard: “Children should be able to travel to and from school and study without the fear of violence.
“This is where we know young people are most at risk of violence and gangs, and it is where our officers will continue to be, ensuring that they are able to quickly respond to any incidents or concerns in the community.
“Although officers will no longer be based in schools, they will join local policing teams where they will retain strong relationships with schools to ensure that any reports of knife crime can be dealt with quickly.
“Officers will also work with local organisations and other youth based establishments to safeguard young people, prevent victimisation and reduce crime and anti-social behaviour beyond schools.”
Join our commenting forum
Join thought-provoking conversations, follow other Independent readers and see their replies

author: Astrologer Ruchi Sharma
title: Virgo Horoscope Today 6 January 2024 Kanya Daily Astrological Predictions Zodiac Signs
text:
Virgo Horoscope Today: Precision is your forte, Virgo! You are known for your meticulous attention to detail, analytical mind, and a relentless desire for order. Virgos are amazing friends, always there to lend a hand and also lend advice. Virgo has a rich inner life, and can sometimes seem shy at first meeting. Your horoscope serves as a map for mastering the art of organization and self-improvement.
Here is what is in store for you today:
For individuals born under the Virgo zodiac sign, today will be an average day. Speaking of employed students, ensure that you make minimal mistakes in your office today; otherwise, your superiors may not be pleased with you. As for businesspersons, treat your customers with respect, considering them as deities. Make efforts to connect with new clients and don't forget about the existing ones while chasing new ones.
For young individuals, focus on your work and avoid interfering in others' tasks; it would be better to keep a low profile. Try to make your elderly family members happy by giving them a thoughtful gift. In terms of health, those suffering from depression should consult a doctor for proper treatment and should stay in regular contact with the doctor.
Be cautious of your enemies today; otherwise, someone might try to cause you trouble. Exercise a little caution and stay alert.

ABPLive.com does not assert the accuracy or validity of any claims or information presented. author: David
title: St Patrick's Church Galway: A Masterpiece Of Gothic Architecture
text:
St. Patrick's Church Mass Times Newbridge, County Galway from www.joinmychurch.org St Patrick’s Church Galway is an iconic building that stands tall in the heart of the city. A masterpiece of Gothic architecture, the church is a testament to the skill and craftsmanship of its builders. It is a place of worship, a cultural treasure, and a must-visit destination for anyone interested in history, art, and architecture.
As you approach the church, you are struck by its imposing presence. The soaring spire, the intricate carvings, and the stained glass windows all demand your attention. The church’s exterior is a work of art, with every detail carefully crafted to create a harmonious whole. The Gothic style is evident in every aspect of the building, from the pointed arches to the elaborate tracery. The church’s façade is a symphony of stone, a testament to the skill and artistry of its builders.
Table of Contents
The Interior: Awe-Inspiring Beauty The Altar: A Centerpiece of Devotion The Bell Tower: A Symbol of Faith The Organ: A Masterpiece of Music The Cemetery: A Place of Remembrance Conclusion The Interior: Awe-Inspiring Beauty Once inside, the church’s beauty continues to inspire. The soaring nave, the vaulted ceiling, and the intricate carvings all combine to create an atmosphere of awe and reverence. The stained glass windows provide a kaleidoscope of colors, casting a warm glow over the entire space. The church’s interior is a masterpiece of Gothic design, with every detail carefully considered to create a space that is both practical and beautiful.
The Altar: A Centerpiece of Devotion The altar is the centerpiece of the church, a place of devotion and prayer. The intricate carvings, the delicate tracery, and the exquisite statuary all combine to create a space that is both beautiful and reverent. The altar is adorned with candles, flowers, and other symbols of devotion, creating a sense of intimacy and warmth. The altar is a reminder of the church’s central purpose: to provide a space for the faithful to come together in prayer and worship.
The Bell Tower: A Symbol of Faith The bell tower is a symbol of faith, a reminder of the church’s mission to spread the gospel to all corners of the world. The tower stands tall and proud, a beacon of hope and inspiration. The bells that ring out from the tower are a call to prayer, a reminder that the faithful are never alone. The tower is a testament to the enduring power of faith, a symbol of hope and resilience in the face of adversity.
The Organ: A Masterpiece of Music The church’s organ is a masterpiece of music, a testament to the power of sound to inspire and uplift. The organ’s intricate pipes, delicate keys, and rich tones all combine to create a sound that is both majestic and intimate. The organ is a symbol of the church’s commitment to the arts, a reminder that beauty and creativity are essential to the human spirit. The organ is a treasure, a gift to the faithful and to all who appreciate the power of music to transcend the ordinary.
The Cemetery: A Place of Remembrance The church’s cemetery is a place of remembrance, a final resting place for the faithful and a reminder of the church’s enduring legacy. The cemetery is a peaceful oasis, a place of quiet contemplation and reflection. The gravestones are a testament to the lives that have been touched by the church, a reminder of the love and devotion that binds the faithful together. The cemetery is a place of beauty and tranquility, a fitting tribute to the church’s commitment to the spiritual well-being of its community.
Conclusion St Patrick’s Church Galway is a masterpiece of Gothic architecture, a testament to the skill and artistry of its builders. The church’s beauty and grandeur are a source of inspiration and awe, a reminder of the enduring power of faith and creativity. From the soaring spire to the intricate carvings, every aspect of the church is a work of art, a testament to the human spirit. Whether you are a believer or not, a visit to St Patrick’s Church Galway is an experience that will stay with you for a lifetime.
Aspect Description Exterior Imposing presence, Gothic style evident in every detail Interior Soaring nave, vaulted ceiling, intricate carvings, stained glass windows Altar Centerpiece of devotion, adorned with candles, flowers, and symbols Bell Tower Symbol of faith, beacon of hope and inspiration, call to prayer Organ Masterpiece of music, powerful and uplifting sound Cemetery Final resting place, peaceful oasis of quiet contemplation and reflection
Source: www.gazettelive.co.uk Source: www.joinmychurch.org Source: www.joinmychurch.org Source: www.flickr.com Source: www.flickr.com Source: www.flickr.com Source: sacredheartgalway.blogspot.com Source: www.flickr.com Source: www.saintpats.org Source: www.flickr.com Source: www.stpatrickscathedral.ca Source: www.saintpats.org Source: sacredheartgalway.blogspot.com
